member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AddInException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an exception is passed between an add-in and the host application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AddInException.#ctor(System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The that is the cause of the current exception, or null if no inner exception is specified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AddInException.System#Runtime#Serialization#ISerializable#GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Adds information about the exception to the specified .
member.param: A that contains the information that is required to serialize the current .
A that contains the source and destination of the serialized stream that is associated with the current .

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.CacheAlreadyLoadedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a document-level customization attempts to load the data cache in a document after the data cache has already been loaded.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.CachedAttribute
member.summary: Instructs the Visual Studio Tools for Office runtime to add the specified data object to the data cache in the document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.CachedAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.CachedDataCouldNotBeSerializedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an attempt to serialize cached data in a document-level customization fails.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.CachedDataTypeMismatchException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the XML serialized state of an object in the data cache does not match the type information for the object in the cached data manifest.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.CannotCacheInNonStartupException
member.summary: This exception is not used by the Visual Studio Tools for Office Runtime version 4.0. It is included in this version of the runtime to maintain compatibility with code that was compiled using earlier versions of the runtime.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.CannotCreateCustomizationDomainException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an application domain cannot be created and the assembly for a Visual Studio Tools for Office solution cannot be loaded.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.CannotCreateStartupObjectException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a host item class in a Visual Studio Tools for Office solution assembly cannot be instantiated.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.CannotFindMemberException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when you try to programmatically add or remove an object from the data cache in a document-level customization, but the specified object is not declared in the specified host item class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.CannotFindObjectToFillException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the Visual Studio Tools for Office runtime cannot locate an object in the data cache of a document-level customization.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.CannotFindStartupObjectAssemblyException
member.summary: This exception is not used by the Visual Studio Tools for Office Runtime version 4.0. It is included in this version of the runtime to maintain compatibility with code that was compiled using earlier versions of the runtime.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.CannotLoadManifestException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the manifest in the document cannot be loaded.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.CannotRetrieveCachedDataException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the cached data in the document is corrupted or missing.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ControlCouldNotBeInitializedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a control that was added to a document in a Visual Studio Tools for Office solution could not be initialized.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ControlNotFoundException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an attempt is made to reference a control in a document-level customization, but the control does not exist.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.DocumentAlreadyCustomizedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when you attempt to attach a customization to a document that is already part of a document-level customization that was created by using Visual Studio Tools for Office.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.DocumentClosedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when you attempt to perform an operation using the class on a closed document.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.DocumentCustomizedWithPreviousRuntimeException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when you attempt to use the class to perform an operation on a document-level customization that was created by using an earlier version of Visual Studio Tools for Office.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.DocumentNotCustomizedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when you try to perform an invalid operation on a document by using the class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostAssemblyAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the assembly in which this attribute appears contains proxy types for the types exposed by the host application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostAssemblyAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostEventAttribute
member.summary: Relates an event in a proxy type to an event in the host application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostEventAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: For COM events only. The dispatch ID of the COM event for which the event marked with this is a proxy.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostEventAttribute.DispId
member.summary: Gets the dispatch ID of the COM event for which the event marked with this is a proxy.
member.returns: The dispatch ID of the COM event for which the event marked with this is a proxy.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostEventAttribute.HostEventMethodType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the kind of event accessor method the host application will use for this event in the proxy type.
member.returns: A value that specifies the kind of event accessor method the host application will use for this event in the proxy type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostEventMethodType
member.summary: Indicates the type of the method in the host application that corresponds to a method in an add-in.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostEventMethodType.Unspecified
member.summary: Indicates that the type of the host event accessor method is not specified. The runtime should determine the type by examining the prefix of the event accessor method name, for example, "add_" or "remove_".

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostEventMethodType.Add
member.summary: Indicates that the host method is used to add an event handler to a delegate.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostEventMethodType.Remove
member.summary: Indicates that the host method is used to remove an event handler from a delegate.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostEventMethodType.Raise
member.summary: Indicates that the host method raises the event.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostEventMethodType.Other
member.summary: Indicates that the host event accessor method type is unspecified, but the runtime should not attempt to determine the type from the method name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostMemberAttribute
member.summary: Sets the way that methods and properties in the proxy are bound to the corresponding members in the host application's object model.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostMemberAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name of the method or property in the host application's object model. This name will usually be the same as the method or property name in the proxy type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostMemberAttribute.BindingFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets a enumeration value that controls binding and the way in which the search for members and types is conducted by reflection.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values that controls binding and the way in which the search for members and types is conducted by reflection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostMemberAttribute.MemberName
member.summary: Gets the name of the member in the host application that the member in the proxy represents.
member.returns: The name of the member in the host application that corresponds to the member in the proxy.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostTypeAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the relationship between a type and its canonical name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostTypeAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The canonical name of the type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostTypeAttribute.CanonicalName
member.summary: Gets the canonical name of the type.
member.returns: The name that the runtime uses to identify the type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostTypeAttribute.ProxyType
member.summary: Gets or sets a instance that describes the proxy type.
member.returns: A instance that describes the proxy type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.HostTypeAttribute.SourceInterfaceGuid
member.summary: For COM only. Gets or sets the GUID of the source interface for a coclass in the host application's object model.
member.returns: The GUID of the source interface for COM events.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ICachedType
member.summary: Customizes the caching behavior of a type in document-level customizations created by using Visual Studio Tools for Office.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ICachedType.AfterLoad
member.summary: Called after the Visual Studio Tools for Office runtime has finished loading the type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ICachedType.AfterSave
member.summary: Called after a save operation is completed for the type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ICachedType.BeforeLoad
member.summary: Called before the Visual Studio Tools for Office runtime loads the type.
member.returns: false if the state of the type should not be loaded from the data cache; otherwise, true.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ICachedType.BeforeSave
member.summary: Called before the Visual Studio Tools for Office runtime persists the type into the document.
member.returns: false if the state of the type should not be saved; otherwise, true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ICachedType.IsDirty
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the cached type has changed since the last time it was saved.
member.returns: true if the cached type has been changed since it was last saved; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.IEntryPoint
member.summary: Provides a handle to the add-in for the host application, enables you to provide discrete initialization steps for an add-in, and enables you to release resources when an add-in shuts down.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.IEntryPoint.FinishInitialization
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, this method performs initializations that can only be completed after the method has been called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.IEntryPoint.Initialize(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, this method supplies you with a handle to the host application's , which can be used to query the host application's object model.
member.param: A service provider from which to get the object in the host application that is used to access the host application's object hierarchy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.IEntryPoint.InitializeDataBindings
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, this method performs initializations that can only happen after the method has been called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.IEntryPoint.OnShutdown
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, this method performs operations that need to be completed before the add-in shuts down.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.IExtendedEntryPoint
member.summary: Extends to enable the host application to get a handle to the add-in object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.IExtendedEntryPoint.GetEntryPointObject
member.summary: Returns a reference to the add-in object.
member.returns: A reference to the add-in object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.IHostItemProvider
member.summary: Provides access to host item objects that are requested by the add-in.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.IHostItemProvider.GetHostObject(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an instance of the requested host item type and a string that identifies that instance.
member.returns: The instance of the specified host item type and a unique identifier.
member.param: The type of the host item object to return.
A string value that uniquely identifies a specific instance of the type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.IHostTypeProvider
member.summary: Enables the add-in to obtain types from the host application's object model, which can then be used to invoke static members.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.IHostTypeProvider.GetHostType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the requested type from the host application's object model.
member.returns: A that represents the requested type in the host application.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.InvalidDeployManifestException
member.summary: This exception is not used by the Visual Studio Tools for Office Runtime version 4.0. It is included in this version of the runtime to maintain compatibility with code that was compiled using earlier versions of the runtime.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.InvalidManifestException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when the application manifest or cached data manifest for the Visual Studio Tools for Office solution is not valid.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.InvalidNewApplicationManifestException
member.summary: This exception is not used by the Visual Studio Tools for Office Runtime version 4.0. It is included in this version of the runtime to maintain compatibility with code that was compiled using earlier versions of the runtime.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ItemAlreadyInCacheException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an attempt is made to add an item to the data cache in a document-level customization, but the item already exists in the cache.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ItemNotInCacheException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an attempt is made to retrieve an item from the data cache in a document-level customization, but the item does not exist.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ITypeMapProvider
member.summary: Enables mapping between the proxy type the add-in uses and the actual host type in the host application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ITypeMapProvider.GetCanonicalNameForType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the canonical name that corresponds to the specified host type.
member.returns: The canonical name for the specified host type.
member.param: The whose canonical name you want to get.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ITypeMapProvider.GetTypeForCanonicalName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the host type that corresponds to the specified canonical name.
member.returns: The host type that corresponds to the specified canonical name.
member.param: The canonical name of the requested type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.MissingDataIdException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a object is saved while the cached data manifest contains a with an property that is null or an empty string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.MissingHostItemIdException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a object is saved while the cached data manifest contains a with an property that is null or an empty string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.MissingTypeException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a object is saved while the cached data manifest contains a with a property that is null or an empty string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.MultipleCachedDataCouldNotBeSerializedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when more than one cached data object could not be serialized in a document-level customization.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.NonCacheableTypeException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an attempt is made to cache an object in a document-level customization, but the type of the object is not a , , or a type that meets the requirements specified in Caching Data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.NoStartupObjectsException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when a Visual Studio Tools for Office solution assembly does not contain a startup object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.NotAvailableOfflineException
member.summary: This exception is not used by the Visual Studio Tools for Office Runtime version 4.0. It is included in this version of the runtime to maintain compatibility with code that was compiled using earlier versions of the runtime.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.NotAvailableOnlineException
member.summary: This exception is not used by the Visual Studio Tools for Office Runtime version 4.0. It is included in this version of the runtime to maintain compatibility with code that was compiled using earlier versions of the runtime.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.RuntimeException
member.summary: Provides the base class for exceptions in Visual Studio Tools for Office runtime.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.SafeArrayDefaultRankAttribute
member.summary: Defines the default rank of an array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.SafeArrayDefaultRankAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a default rank.
member.param: The default rank of the array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.SafeArrayDefaultRankAttribute.DefaultRank
member.summary: Gets the default rank of the array.
member.returns: An value that represents the default rank of the array.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.UnknownCustomizationFileException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when you pass a file with an extension that is not supported by Visual Studio Tools for Office to a constructor or method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.UpdateFailedException
member.summary: This exception is not used by the Visual Studio Tools for Office Runtime version 4.0. It is included in this version of the runtime to maintain compatibility with code that was compiled using earlier versions of the runtime.
